steps: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Add olive oil to a medium-sized baking dish.. Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add cabbage leaves; cook until tender, about 12 minutes. Drain.. While cabbage is cooking, add sausage to a skillet over medium-high heat; cook and stir until browned and crumbly, breaking into pieces as it cooks, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain and discard grease.. Meanwhile, combine marinara sauce and tomato sauce in a saucepan over medium-low heat; cook until warm, about 3 minutes. Set aside.. Combine sausage, cooked rice, 1/2 cup sauce, basil, and oregano in a bowl; spread onto cabbage leaves and roll up like small burritos. The amount of filling will vary depending on size of cabbage leaves. Place cabbage rolls close together into the prepared baking dish; spoon remaining sauce over top.. Bake in the preheated oven until cooked through, about 30 minutes. Garnish with more basil and oregano.

name: Instant Pot Cabbage Roll Casserole
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'ground turkey'}, {'quantity': '⅔', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped onion'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large head', 'name': 'cabbage, cut into 1-inch chunks'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(28 ounce) can', 'name': 'Italian-style diced tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(14.5 ounce) can', 'name': 'chicken broth'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'uncooked long grain white rice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'dried basil, divided'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'shredded Cheddar cheese, divided'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(15 ounce) can', 'name': 'tomato sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'white sugar'}
steps: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot) and select Saute function. Add turkey and onion; cook and stir until turkey is browned and crumbly and onion is translucent, 5 to 7 minutes.. Add cabbage, diced tomatoes, chicken broth, water, rice, Worcestershire sauce, 1 teaspoon basil, salt, and pepper. Stir occasionally until mixture starts to boil, 5 to 7 minutes. Make sure the mixture does not exceed the max fill line.. Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 5 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.. While the cabbage-rice mixture is cooking, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).. Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 8 minutes. Then use the quick-release method by gently pushing the steam release knob towards the venting position without pushing it fully into position; release remaining pressure in short bursts.. Remove the Instant Pot lid and stir in 1 cup of Cheddar cheese.. Combine tomato sauce, sugar, and remaining basil in a bowl. Pour 1/2 of the sauce into a 9x13-inch baking dish. Spoon cabbage-rice mixture over the sauce, then spoon remaining sauce over top. Sprinkle with remaining Cheddar.. Bake in the preheated oven until heated through, 25 to 30 minutes.

steps: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir ground turkey in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes; drain and discard grease. Transfer cooked turkey to a bowl.. Heat olive oil in the skillet over medium heat; saute onion in hot oil until translucent, about 5 minutes. name: Norwegian Cabbage Rolls
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'unsalted butter'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'yellow onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': '80% lean ground beef'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cooked rice'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'heavy whipping cream'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'egg'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'finely chopped fresh Italian parsley'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'potato starch'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'coarsely ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'whole caraway seeds'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground ginger'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cloves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large heads', 'name': 'cabbage, cored'}
steps: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a baking pan.. Heat butter in a skillet over medium heat; stir in onion. Cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes.. Transfer onion to a large mixing bowl and add beef, cooked rice, cream, egg, parsley, potato starch, 2 teaspoons salt, pepper, caraway seeds, ginger, nutmeg, and cloves. Mix to combine in an even consistency and refrigerate filling until needed.. Bring a large pot of generously salted water to a boil. Place 1 head of cabbage in the boiling water and parboil until bright green and leaves are softened, about 2 minutes. Carefully remove cabbage with tongs or a large fork. Repeat with remaining head of cabbage. Allow to cool, about 10 minutes.. Remove outer leaves from the cooled cabbage. Lay 1 leaf flat on a work surface and cut out the stem. Spoon a generous 2 tablespoons of filling into the center of the leaf. Fold the corners at the stem end diagonally over the filling, fold the sides over, and roll up like a tiny burrito. Place in the prepared baking pan. Repeat to make remaining cabbage rolls until filling is used up.. Add water to the baking pan until it is halfway up the sides of the cabbage rolls.. Bake in the preheated oven until beef is cooked through and no longer pink, about 40 minutes.
